pr_title: Ensure entities are inserted only on create

timeline.bodyText: What was wrong with the previous approach? Why do we keep taking fields out of RecordItem and passing them separately? It breaks encapsulation and is not OO. We can simply pass record item.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
Previous approach has transaction build logic dispersed, therefore making it harder to follow and maintain.
Aim here was to move all transaction build logic into the buildTransaction method.
True better to just pass RecordItem. My gut had performance concerns but it think we explored that already and it turned out to not be an issue.
Will update this to take in RecordItem
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Reverted logic and will move out to a separate PR
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: This seems to set the entityId on the transaction even if it's unsuccessful and doesn't get added to the entities table later. Should probably be moved into the isSuccessful block. We should add this check to tests.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
Realized this after, might explain some of the issues with the tests.
With the update of buildTransaction()  to take RecordItem I can keep the logic in and add the success check for entity creation
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText:
Actually I'm planning on splitting buildTransaction() out to buildTransaction() and insertTransaction().
It conforms with the other transaction specific methods as it will be responsible fo rebuilding the object based on recordItem details and calling the entityListener.onX() method
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Will move this to a separate PR with OnItem refactoring improvements and revert a few of these improvements as they're out of scope
